# Slime People
### Homeworld Xarxis in the Delta Equuleus System
### Temperment Slime people tend to be a bit on the eccentric side, with a deep love of exploration.
### Secondary Species of Interest IPC - Slimepeople find IPCs fascinating, the amount of complexity and difference in their biologies being so wide only fuels the Slimes desire to understand.
Shelegs - Slime people are wary of the frigid Shelegs, finding them good companions but perhaps not the best to be in tight quarters with.
Rodentia - The small rodentia's natural curiosity and love of exploration fit in well with most slime peoples interests, the two are often seen as two peas in a pod.
They breathe nitrogen instead of oxygen, which is abundant in the station air, but harder to find compressed into gas tanks. They take significant damage if they are sprayed or splashed with water, but can (and like other species, need to) drink it safely to stay hydrated. They exhale nitrous oxide and are unaffected by it. Their body can process 6 reagents at the same time instead of just 2.
Slimepeople have an [bold]internal 2x3 storage inventory[/bold] inside of their slime membrane. Anyone can see what's inside and take it out of you without asking, so be careful.
Slimepeople have slight accelerated regeneration compared to other humanoids. They're also capable of hardening their fists, and as such have stronger punches, although they punch a little slower.
Their slime "blood" can not be regenerated from Iron. Slime Blood is technically a source of moderately filling food for other species, although drinking the blood of your coworkers is usually frowned upon. They suffocate 80% slower, but take pressure damage 9% faster. This makes them by far the species most capable to survive in hard vacuum. For a while.
They take [color=#1e90ff]40% less Blunt damage and 20% less Poison damage[/color], but [color=#ffa500]50% more Cold damage, 20% more Slash damage and 20% more Piercing damage[/color].
